TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the abstract class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the Visual Web Designer, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class serves as the base class for designers that provide design-time support in the Visual Web Designer for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class properties provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> properties provide access to the corresponding properties of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> indicate the fields of the data source that provide the text and value content of the list items, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> to a design-time data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> component from the associated control container.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> from the control container, resolved to the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view and design the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method is called when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> for the associated control has changed.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove additional properties from, add additional properties to, or shadow properties of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>.
## Examples This section provides two code examples. The first demonstrates how to derive a custom control designer. The second demonstrates how to associate a derived control with a designer.
The following code example shows how to create a class named `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class. The `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> methods. The `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class displays a `SimpleRadioButtonList` control on the design surface.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlistdesigner.vb#1)]
The following code example derives the `SimpleRadioButtonList` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, and shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> class to associate the `SimpleRadioButtonList` control with its designer, the `SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner` class.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonList.cs#5)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlist.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActionLists As DesignerActionListCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub DataBind (dataBoundControl As BaseDataBoundControl)

Docs.param: The associated control derived from the , or a copy of that control.
Docs.summary: Binds the specified control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner> base class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> object to reference the design-time data source, then calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method, and then restores the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties to their original values.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class, however, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method has no functionality, because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects were just added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data text field of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataTextField%2A> property sets or retrieves the markup to use for the design-time representation of the control at run time. This provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> property of the associated control, which corresponds to the field of the data source that provides the text content of the list items.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DataValueField { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DataValueField : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data value field of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.DataValueField%2A> property provides access via the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> property of the associated control, which indicates the field of the data source that provides the value content of the list items.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: A containing the markup used to render the control derived from the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the associated control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object is data-bound, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection and adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is data-bound. If the associated control is not data-bound and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> adds a <xref:System.String> message indicating the control is unbound. Then, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> calls its base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to customize the markup that is displayed for the associated control on a design surface. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> property is not defined for the associated control, it is set to `Gainsboro`, and the control is displayed with that background color. After this is done, the base implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method is called.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner.cs#2)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlistdesigner.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetResolvedSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container, resolved to a specific data member.
Docs.returns: An containing the design-time , resolved to the of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> cannot be resolved to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner.DataMember%2A> property of the associated control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an interface and containing the design-time of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method returns `null` if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property is not found, or if a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> with the same name does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Initialize (component As IComponent)

Docs.param: A control derived from the that implements an .
Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, that is associated with this designer or is a copy of that control.
## Examples The following code example overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> method in a designer derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class to ensure that only instances of a control class named `SimpleRadioButtonList` are used by the custom designer.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner.cs#3)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlistdesigner.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnComponentChanged (object source, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnComponentChanged(object source, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub OnComponentChanged (source As Object, ce As ComponentChangedEventArgs)
public: override void OnComponentChanged(System::Object ^ source, System::ComponentModel::Design::ComponentChangedEventArgs ^ ce);

remarks.format: ## Remarks Handles changes made to the component. This includes changes made in the property grid.

Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source.
## Examples The following code example overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method in a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class. When the data source that is associated with the designer class changes, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method is called and this code sets a variable named `changedDataSource` to `true`.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlistdesigner.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged(bool forceUpdateView) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnDataSourceChanged (forceUpdateView As Boolean)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A that indicates whether the design-time markup is to be unconditionally updated. This parameter is ignored.
Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class to the current data source and, if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, updates the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method of the designer unconditionally updates the design-time markup after connecting to the current data source. The value of `forceUpdateView` is ignored.
## Examples The following code example overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method in a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class. When the data source that is associated with the designer class changes, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> is called and this code sets a variable named `changedDataSource` to `true`.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner> class.
[!code-csharp[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/CS/SimpleRadioButtonListDesigner.cs#4)] [!code-vb[ListControlDesigner_Samples#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListControlDesigner_Samples/VB/simpleradiobuttonlistdesigner.vb#4)]

block.para: Callers should use the public override.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub PreFilterProperties (properties As IDictionary)

Docs.param: A collection implementing the of the added or shadowed properties to expose for the associated control at design time.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove additional properties from or add properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataFieldConverter> attribute to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties of the associated control.

block.para: Override the method to add properties to or change attributes of properties in the design-time property collection. Be sure to call the base method before performing other processing.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property UseDataSourcePickerActionList As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool UseDataSourcePickerActionList { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated control should render its default action lists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListControlDesigner.UseDataSourcePickerActionList%2A> property returns `false` so that a data source dropdown is not displayed with the **Choose Data Source** menu item in the **Common Tasks** context menu. Instead, this menu item displays the **Choose Data Source** dialog box, which allows the user to select a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties.

block.para: Override the property to return if you want the control that is derived from the class to display a data source dropdown with the **Choose Data Source** menu item in the **Common Tasks** context menu at design time.
